org.swisscheese.swisscheese.uiWindows

Class InGameMenu

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Dialog
            • javax.swing.JDialog
              • org.swisscheese.swisscheese.uiWindows.InGameMenu
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants

    public final class InGameMenu
extends javax.swing.JDialog
    This class is the in-game menu that the user sees when they open the menu in the game.
    Since:
    2018-12-23, v0.5
    Version:
    v0.2
    Author:
    Alex Kalinins
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • InGameMenu

        private InGameMenu()
        Private Constructor. The only way to display the Menu is through display().

    • Method Detail

      • bottomButtonContainer

        private java.awt.Container bottomButtonContainer()
        Makes a Container that contains two JButtons; goBack and exitGame.

        Also assigns action listeners to buttons.

        Returns:
        new Container with buttons.

      • initCards

        private void initCards()
        Makes and adds each card of the menu to mainPanel, into a CardLayout.

        The keyBindsPanel is a KeyBindsPanel.

        See Also:
        CardLayout, KeyBindsPanel

      • makeSettingsCard

        private javax.swing.JPanel makeSettingsCard()
        Makes the 'settings' card of the menu. At the moment, it is empty and has no features. In the future, buttons, labels and other components will be added to a JScrollPane.

        This card does not contain KeyBind settings; they are made by makeKeyBindsCard().

        Returns:
        a JPanel containing a JScrollPane with settings components.

      • makeHomeCard

        private javax.swing.JPanel makeHomeCard()
        Makes the 'home' card of the menu.

        Also assigns action listeners to buttons.

        Returns:
        a JPanel that is added to the CardLayout of mainPanel.

      • saveGame

        private void saveGame()

      • exitGame

        private void exitGame()

      • display

        public static void display()
        Creates a Menu if it is not being displayed already. Otherwise, it calls goBack to either return to the 'home' card of the menu or to quit the menu and resume the game.

      • dispose

        public void dispose()
        Resumes the game and disposes of the JFrame.
        Overrides:
        dispose in class java.awt.Window

      • goBack

        private void goBack()
        Action of the "Return" button of the menu. If the homePanel is visible, returns back to game. If homePane is not visible, calls CardLayout to show HOME card.
